required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Cohort Study Comparing Surgeon Stress, Utilization of Surgical Instruments, Surgical Outcomes According to Surgical Approach for Gastrectomy
clinical_study.official_title: Cohort Study Comparing Surgeon Stress, Utilization of Surgical Instruments, Surgical Outcomes According to Surgical Approach for Gastrectomy

brief_summary.textblock: A new surgical instrument is supposed to allow surgeon to do surgery with better performance. However, the learning period before getting used to the new instruments is necessary. The surgeon's stress to overcome the learning effect and the surgical outcome was rarely assessed. The comparative analysis of surgical outcome, surgeon's stress, and utilization of instruments for gastrectomy will be performed in prospective cohort study

detailed_description.textblock: Before the surgery, all the eligible patients will be explained regarding the study and informed consent will be given. During the surgery, the surgeon will wear heart rate monitoring device to monitor hear rate variability of the surgeon. The surgical procedure will be recorded. After the surgery, morbidity following surgery will be monitored and recorded. At 1 month after surgery, additional morbidity will be recorded.

primary_outcome.description: One of the most important surgical outcome, complication will be measured at 1 month after surgery

secondary_outcome.measure: number of use for each surgical instruments

arm_group.description: laparoscopic surgery using conventional laparoscopic instruments
Using wristed laparoscopic instruments (Artisential Maryland dissector, Artisential Fenestrated grasper)
Use of single site system for reduced port robotic surgery
Use of da Vinci SP system for reduced port robotic surgery
A new surgical robot Revo-i developed by Meerae company in Korea

study_pop.textblock: Patients with gastric cancer scheduled to undergo gastrectomy in high volume center

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
Patients with gastric cancer scheduled for gastrectomy
Exclusion Criteria:
Vulnerable subject (illiterate, pregnant)

facility.name: Severance Hospital, Yonsei University Health System
